name: Renaissance Humanism
description: Key figures of the Renaissance humanist movement (c.1300-1600), including Italian pioneers like Petrarch and Boccaccio, Florentine Neoplatonists like Ficino and Pico della Mirandola, Northern Christian humanists like Erasmus and Thomas More, and the scholars, patrons, and institutions that shaped European intellectual life.
author: HistoryNet Contributors
